availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph B. Puthoff (Greenup County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rhoda Puthoff, Father of Elizabeth Putthoff, Melena Putthoff, and John W. Puthoff. Farmer in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Greenup County in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed Silas Drake as a day laborer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed Eveline Osburn as a domestic servant in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup. County, District 1, p. 219B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 248.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 765-766.
